page.title: 15ALL SAINTS CHURCH
page.content: All Saints Old Buckenham is an unusual church because it has a thatched roof and an octagonal tower from the foundations upwards. There are some pieces of Norman architecture still standing in this church, which is probably built on the site of a previous one. In the moulding of the chancel arch are four carved stone faces, two of which are thought to be Queen Adelicia, widow of Henry I, and William d'Albini, the Norman baron who built the castle near New Buckenham and the Priory. The portraits were probably carved in the late 14th century. There is a memorial to Major William Keppel and his wife in the choir stalls, which forms a link with their relatives, the Earls of Albemarle, in one of Old Buckenham's sister parishes, Quidenham.
